article.title: Horizon
article.text: [http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HoRiznsHbJAqs2bmrVcSd79NTGVFp4Ju2/ Link] Horizon is a new search engine implementation for ZeroNet. The site was authored by developer [[blurhy]]. ==Required Environment== * Zeronet Rev > 3582 ==The Principle== Horizon's data is compiled from its spider software, [https://github.com/blurHY/HorizonSpider HorizonSpider]. The spider works by crawling zeronet pages, then compiling the data it finds into a MySQL database. This data is then exported to JSON, and when the site is started for the first time the JSON is converted back into an efficiently queryable database using [[ZeroNet]]'s built in SQLite functionality. Searches are then conducted by searching this database via ZeroNet's [[ZeroFrame]] API. ===Search Speed=== Comments from blurhy (Sep 25,2018): I need to find a balance between slow database building and slow query. Also the data is very huge. Maybe Horizon's database is the biggest. I'm improving it now. ===Further Thoughts=== Comments from blurhy (Sep 25,2018): Horizon isn't the final solution to the search problem of zeronet. You would see a lot of result because of it has huge data. If you download the 1.5TB whole zeronet, you will get more result. That spider just crawls keywords and a few phrases. So you can't get any result if you search a sentence. So the final problem is How to search in non-downloaded zites * Search in other peers databases. [https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1602 Github issue] ==Links== [zero://1KkHNyD9TA5bi4gwGDYuTKSWp94MQEqrS1 HorizonTalk] - A talk for Horizon
